page.title: 01SUMMARY OF AREA
page.content: The area covered is to the west of the village of Albrighton.It has no concentrated centre of population apart from the quarters,workshops and offics of R.A.F.Cosford.What people there are live mainly on the farms and in farm cottages apart from the houses which are scattered along the A464. The area is incredibly flat with a range of low hills running NE-SW across the SW corner.This produces good agricultural land which is used both for cattle-rearing and crop growing. The River Worfe runs diagonally N-SW across the area providing a variety in the landscape.There are areas of wood- land along the Worfe and are found in the main within the grounds of Hatton Grange. The A464 and main railway line run parallel diagonally across the area
